result.title: Andrew Stankevich Contests — 46 contests later
result.content:
Good evening, Codeforces.

Some time ago I added the last 46th Andrew Stankevich Contest to the Gym. Now all of them are added. Here is a complete list and the group with all the contests.

Now I want to tell what was done during the process of adding all the contests to the gym.

   

  • In some problems tests and checkers (the program to check if the participant's answer is correct if it is ambigious) are fixed. Errors were found not only by me, but by the members of Codeforces community as well.

  • In most of the archive tests were generated from scratch. I tried to use the sam compiler versions because some test generator program used built-in pseudorandom number generator and they can produce different numbers in different compilers.

  • In old contests time limits were adapted to fit on modern computers. For more precise time limit tuning I used not only jury's solutions from the contest archives, but actual solutions from the contestants of the Petrozavodks Training Camps. All used solutions are available in Gyms if you have coach access.

Andrew Stankevick Contests materials are distributed under Creative Commons 4.0 Attribution license. My work with ASCs is finished for now. But soon Winter Petrozavodks Training Camp 2014-2015 will take place and, I hope, that Andrew Stankevich Contest 47 will be successfully held there. And after it I will successfully add it to the Gym.

Also, I want to inform you, that from now on I am not Codeforces developer any more. I was a developer for 1.5 year. During this time I learned a lot of interesting things and implemented, I hope, useful features for Codeforces, Polygon and you, dear users. Validator and checker tests in Polygon, groups, mashups and so on. This 1.5 year is unforgettable for me. Thank you.

With best regards, Ivan.
